conclusion: Apply principles of electrostatics and mechanics to analyze forces on the ball from point A to B.
Identify given information: tube geometry, equilateral triangle, point charges, ball mass and charge.
Determine forces: initial velocity zero, electric force formula, gravitational force.
Distance r from M to B is L due to equilateral triangle.
Electric force F = kQ^2/L^2 by substituting r = L.
Velocity at point B is v = sqrt(2mgL/(m + Q^2/L^2)).
Distance traveled from A to B is d = R + L.
Electric force at point B is F = kQ^2/R^2.
Net force on ball is F_net = kQ^2/R^2 - mg.
Magnitude of electric force is kQ^2/R^2.
Conclude magnitude of electric force at point B is kQ^2/R^2.
